155321.title: In Recovery

choices: They are in the middle of a vast empty wasteland, no living creature in sight.
They see what looks like a small village or town a short distance away.
15533.content:
"BEGINNING FINAL LANDING PROCEDURES - STAGE ONE: REAWAKENING"

Skylar opened his eyes, something that was surprisingly difficult. A disoriented feeling washed over him, not unlike what had happened a few months ago when he had stolen a bottle of beer from the market and chugged it all down at once. As he blinked several times and tried to focus his eyes, he noticed that he was in a very small, dimly lit, confined area, and he couldn't move his arms or legs. He started to shiver involuntarily, and he could see his breath. An uneasy feeling came over him, but he couldn't quite place the reason.

"STAGE ONE COMPLETE - BEGINNING STAGE TWO: STABILIZING CABIN"

A few feet to his right, his younger brother Caleb was already wide-eyed and anxious for the pods to open so he could finally get out and stretch his legs. He had experienced much less confusion and disorientation from the hibernation process than Skylar had, and quickly remembered why they were in this situation: they had been found guilty of a double homicide, something which they both knew was a load of bullshit but which they couldn't afford to hire a good enough defense against. As they were orphans and had already had a troubled record, they were given a new experimental sentence: expulsion from the planet. That's why they were on this small starship programed to take them to a planet several dozen light-years away: they were no longer welcome at home.

"STAGE TWO COMPLETE - BEGINNING STAGE THREE: RELEASING PRISONER RESTRAINTS"

A loud hissing sound filled the air, causing Skylar to jump a little. He breathed a sigh of relief as he realized it was just the air pressure leveling out as his pod opened. As the hissing stopped, the glass quickly slid away, and he could feel a rush of fresh air slam into his face. The restraints around his arm and leg unclamped, and he gingerly climbed out of the pod onto the cabin floor, his muscles ginger from disuse. As he looked around, he realized where he was -- and began to remember why.

"Skylar!" Caleb called out, running up to his brother and throwing his arms around him, embracing him tightly. "Are you okay?"

"Oof!" Skylar grunted, knocked back a little by his more exuberant twelve-year-old brother. He didn't blame the kid, though. Even before the expulsion, the two were the only family they each had. It didn't matter that there was a four year gap separating them - they were the best of friends. And nothing could change that.

"Yeah, I'm all right, Caleb," Skylar replied, patting his brother on the back and trying to reassure him. "I'm just still having a hard time getting used to this."

The younger boy nodded. "I don't blame you. That's probably part of the punishment, I guess."

"STAGE THREE COMPLETE - BEGINNING STAGE FOUR: APPROACHING DESTINATION"

As soon as the mechanical voice said those words, the small ship they were on began to shake violently, knocking them both back against the wall.

"What's going on?" Caleb cried out, fear evident in his eyes.

"I-- I don't know!" Skylar rushed to the lone computer display in the cabin, studying it furiously. "I think we're entering the atmosphere of a planet. Hopefully this shaking won't last--"

Suddenly, the shaking stopped, and they could hear a loud whistling coming from outside the ship. At the same time, their bodies began to feel slightly heavier, the planet's gravity compounding with the effects of the artificial gravity field of their ship.

"Hang on tight, Caleb!" Skylar instructed, and both boys grabbed onto a couple of handles that were sticking out of the wall. After a few seconds that seemed like years, the ship came to a sudden and complete stop. The air was completely silent now, save for the heavy breathing of the two boys.

"LANDING PROCEDURE COMPLETE. ALL PRISONERS MUST EVACUATE SHIP. SELF DESTRUCT SEQUENCE WILL COMMENCE IN TWO MINUTES."

"Self destruct!" Both boys looked at each other in shock.

"C'mon, Skylar," Caleb grabbed his older brother by the arm, heading for the ship's airlock. "We've got to get out of here!"

Within a minute and a half, Skylar and Caleb had both jumped from the ship's door to the ground two feet below, and they quickly ran as far as they could from it. Luckily, there were a safe distance away by the time the self-destruct sequence activated and the ship disappeared in a small explosion.

"Shit," Skylar said, shaking his head. "I guess they really don't want us to go back. I hope this planet is as hospitable as they promised us." The two boys stopped to catch their breath again before turning to examine their surroundings.
15533.title: No Longer Welcome at Home

choices: Something disturbs them in the night...
The next morning they explore more, traveling fruther from the village
155332.content:
Skylar shielded his eyes from the somewhat harsh light of the sun and looked around. Things didn't look too different from their home planet. The sparse plant life situated among the rocks seemed strikingly similar. The landscape was rough and rocky, dirt and dust swirling around them in the light breeze. Caleb winced and covered his mouth, coughing heavily into his hands. Skylar immediately patted him on the back and pulled out a small flask of water. Caleb eagerly drank from it. When he was done, he wiped his mouth and said, "Where did you get this?"

Skylar ruffled Caleb's hair and said, "Don't worry about it Cal. I figured we might need to have some supplies on us just in case those bastards back home were lying about how "hospitable" this place was."

Caleb frowned as he looked at the flask. "Did you steal it?"

"Like I said, don't worry about it." His voice was firmer, the tone indicating that there would be no more discussion. Caleb sighed and screwed the top back on the flask, shaking it slightly.

"I think I drank too much...It's almost empty."

Skylar took the flask back and held it up to his ear, shaking it slightly. The sound of water sloshing around inside indicated there was about a quarter of it left. "Come on, let's look around. I'm sure we'll be able to find something."

Caleb nodded and grabbed his brother's hand. The two brothers began to walk together along the rocky path, slowly making their way down what appeared to be a mountain. They were dressed in tight, form fitting space suits, dark blue in color, making them stand out amongst the grey rocks. Skylar looked around slightly nervously. There was no telling what kind of animals would be on this planet. The judge back home (could they even call it that anymore?) had been quite firm that, while the planet would be hospitable, with food,water, and shelter, they were still condemned criminals. This "Prison Planet" experiment (as it was called in all the media) had many supporters as well as detractors. Those who were for it argued that the planet would be a better place if all the most ruthless and evil criminals were forced to leave while those who were against it hated that their tax quixes were going to support an entire planet full of the worst the planet could offer. Skylar couldn't care less about any of that. All it meant to him was that his little brother and he were forced from the only home they had ever known.

"It doesn't matter." Skylar thought to himself as he gripped Caleb's hand tightly. "We never needed anyone but each other and we never will."

Skylar was so deep in thought that it took several shakes of his arm by Caleb before he snapped back to attention. "Huh? What's wrong Caleb?"

"Look!" He said, somewhat impatiently, pointing a something in the distance.

Skylar looked and saw what appeared to be a small village, situated at the bottom of the mountain. Skylar was a bit surprised to see an entire town there, but just because they were the first people sent here, didn't mean they would be the last. The path they were currently on seemed to lead directly to the village. "Well, I guess that's our new home now."

"Do we actually get to sleep in a house?" Caleb asked, sounding surprised.

"Guess so." Skylar said, shrugging.

Caleb couldn't help but smile. He had spent his whole life on the streets, sleeping in any shelter that they could find. To have an actual home to live in had been a luxury he didn't think he would be allowed! He picked up the pace, letting go of Skylar's hand and running a little ahead. "Don't go running off!" Skylar shouted, chasing after him. Caleb just giggled and ran on, jumping over rocks and sliding down some loose gravel.

It didn't take too long to reach the village. Caleb got to the bottom of the mountain first, turning and crossing his arms triumphantly. "I win!"

"We weren't even racing shorty." Skylar said, ruffling Caleb's hair again.

"Hey, don't call me shorty! I'm not short!" Caleb said in a huff. Being undersized for his age (thanks to a lack of nutrition), his height was a bit of a sore point to him.

"Right, right, sorry Cal." Skylar said, smiling slightly.

Caleb tried to fix his hair as they walked along the main street of the village. There wasn't a lot to it; a few houses, what appeared to be a convenience store, a clothing store, and not much else. The houses were all one story affairs. Peeking inside the window of one of them, it appeared they were only three rooms: a big living space, a bathroom, and a bedroom. The furniture inside was sparse and there didn't appear to be any extra amenities like television. Still, it was more than the brothers had had before. "Maybe this won't be so bad..." He thought to himself, cautiously optimistic.

Caleb wiggled the doorknob, but it wouldn't budge. "I think it's locked."

"Well, lets just keep walking and see what we find."

The two brothers continued down the road, testing the doors on the various houses only to find all of them locked. The convenience and clothing stores were both open but supplies were limited. Caleb immediately pulled a bunch of different outfits from down off their hangers, wanting to try a bunch of them on. Skylar stopped him and said, "Just take one or two for now. We still don't know where we're living."

Caleb nodded and chose two outfits he liked, Skylar doing the same. The convenience store had a few staples (bread, dairy, meat, etc.) all stored in freezers. They left the food and drinks alone for now, moving to the last house in the village. There was a key taped to the door here. Skylar took it down and unlocked the door, stepping inside the house. Caleb ran ahead of him, looking in all the rooms. "Cool, bunk beds! I want the top one!"

Skylar dropped their clothes off on the bottom bunk and said, "Come on, lets change and get something to eat."

The rest of the day passed uneventfully. They ate a small dinner, looked around the village and the forest area surrounding the village, and when it got dark they went back inside and locked the door. Skylar couldn't help but feel a bit uneasy. There were no animals around at all. Everything was strangely silent. All the food and clothes and shelter...it was too convenient.

His thoughts were interrupted when Caleb let out a big yawn, rubbing his eyes. He tried to hide it, but Skylar saw and immediately said, "Bed time."

Caleb groaned and got to his feet. "Fine..."

He climbed up into the top bunk and crawled under the covers, falling asleep almost immediately. Skylar turned off the lights and got into his own bed, staring up at the bottom of his brother's bed, listening to his steady breathing. He was surprisingly tired himself. He had intended to stay awake and plan out their next day, but he fell asleep within minutes.
155332.title: Starting a New Life

choices: Caleb has snuck outside, excited to see their "guests".
Caleb's found a secret passageway in the house, and is trying to flee to safety.
1553321.content:
Out of the darkness, a sudden, loud thumping filled the air, causing Skylar to jolt straight up in bed, wide awake with his heart racing.

”Geez, Zalus, try and be a little more quiet!” The unfamiliar voice came from outside the house. It sounded like it belonged to a boy around their age, but it was much too loud and booming for that to be possible. ”Look out! Watch where you're--”

A crashing sound interrupted him, along with a loud splintering and a massive thud that shook the ground.

”--stepping.”

”Oops! Sorry!” This voice belonged to a different boy, slightly younger sounding. He giggled, and more splintering and cracking could be heard from that direction.

”What the fuck could that be?” Skylar whispered to himself. The scientists who had given them the minimum preparations for this trip had promised them the planet would be deserted until they got there, so hearing other voices that spoke the same language as them was the last thing he was expecting -- much less to have them be so roaring. He quickly slid out of the bed, standing up and turning back towards the top bunk. ”Cal?” He wasn't surprised to see his younger brother still asleep; a life of growing up on the run and having to sleep in the streets and other noisy places had given the young boy an uncanny ability to sleep through practically anything, something that Skylar's body never adjusted to. He considered giving him a good shake, but he decided to try and find out what was going on first.

Slowly stepping towards the bedroom window, he peered outside, not noticing anything out of the ordinary at first. The neighborhood, or whatever it was, didn't have any street lamps or any other artificial sources of light, so the only illumination came from the stars and the twin moons up above. Luckily, one of the moons was full tonight, so that allowed him to see decently well. Still, because of where the bedroom was situated on the backside of the house, the angle he was looking out did not give him a clear view of the street at all.

Taking a deep breath, he made his way towards the front of the house. The shades on the front windows had been drawn before they had arrived at the house, which thankfully concealed him, for now at least. As he approached them, though, he could see shadows and outlines moving outside -- large figures, from the looks of it.

"I hope that's not the house they chose to sleep in," the older boy's voice from outside said. "Otherwise we just hiked all the way out here for nothing."

"Nah," the younger boy replied, "this one doesn't have any furniture or anything in it. I'm pretty sure this is one of the ones just here for show."

Skylar placed a hand on the opening of a window shade, pulling back one side slightly so he could have a look outside. His jaw fell open in shock as he saw two boys standing in front of a half-destroyed house on the other side of the street - but not just any boys. These two stood at least twenty feet tall, rising above the roofs of the houses around them. Skylar stared at them, trying to comprehend what he was seeing. Their faces appeared more or less like boys from his own planet. One boy looked to be around fourteen, with olive-colored skin and deep brown eyes, though his hair was a striking iridescent violet and reached down to his shoulders. He had an extraordinarily muscled physique, like that of a bodybuilder; his white short-sleeve t-shirt and red shorts seemed to fit his form exactly, even going as far as to reveal a noticeable bulge between his legs. The boy next to him, who was brushing himself off from the debris of the wall he had crushed, looked to be several years younger, around Caleb's age, and had very pale skin and fiery red hair, which was short and spiky, and bright green eyes that seemed to glow in the moonlight. Skylar did notice a series of ridges down the back of his neck, noticeable but nothing too scary or exotic. This boy was surprisingly taller than his companion by a foot or so, but had a much skinnier build -- still impressive for his apparent age, something that was more like a late teenage swimmer's build, made all the more noticeable by the fact that his clothes seemed not to fit as well as his friend's, leaving most of his stomach exposed and only covering less than half of his thighs.

"Well, just make sure you're careful, all right, Zalus?" the older-looking boy said. "I hope you're not that clumsy when you're playing with your brother. You might kill him, you know."

"Hey!" Zalus's eyebrows furrowed. "Don't even joke about that kind of thing, Markis. Okay?"

"Fine, fine, whatever," Markis rolled his eyes. "We've still got the matter of finding the two new arrivals before sunrise. We've searched all the other empty settlements, so they have to be here!"

Skylar didn't like what he was hearing at all. Too many questions were running through his head on what all of this meant and how any of this could be possible, but the number one priority he now had was to make sure Caleb was safe and for them to both get to safety.

He quickly ran back to the bedroom, trying to remain in as calm a mindset as he could, considering the circumstances. "Caleb! Wake up!" He continued to speak in a whisper, but tried to be loud enough for his brother to hear him. "We've got to get out of--"

As he reached towards the top bunk, he realized that it was empty! Whirling around, he cried out, "Caleb?! Where are you?!" When only silence answered him, he started to search the rest of the house, praying that his brother was still okay.
1553321.title: Well, THAT'S Unexpected

choices: It's a sprawling village, with houses and buildings of wildly different sizes.
It's a strange ceremonial temple of some kind.
15533211.content:
Skylar began to tear around the house, trying to find his brother. He wasn't anywhere to be seen! There weren't a lot of places to hide in the small house. Under the bed, in the bathroom,behind the shower curtain, in a closet, but that was it. Skylar ran back to the window to make sure the giants weren't getting any closer to where he was and he did a double take as he saw Caleb running up to the one apparently called "Zalus". "CALEB!" Skylar shouted, opening the door and charging out into the night. Both Zalus and Markis looked down in surprise as Caleb and Skylar ran over to them. After so many hours of searching it was a bit of a shock when the objects of their search found them instead! Skylar grabbed Caleb around the arm when they were just a few feet in front of Zalus'...well, feet and and dragged him backward, drawing a little yelp from the younger boy.

"Ow! Skylar, what did you do that for?" He said, frowning up at his brother.

"Caleb, you can't just go running outside when you see something like THAT!" He shouted, pointing at Zalus. "They could be dangerous! Now come on let's go!"

"Hey!" Zalus said, crossing his arms and tilting his head with a frown. "I'm not a "that" I'm a person just like you!"

"No, Zalus, you're not. These two aren't from your planet." Markis said, rolling his eyes.

"Huh? Are you sure?" Zalus said, bending down and leaning in closer, those bright, almost glowing eyes studying Caleb and Skylar curiously.

"Yeah!" Markis said, grabbing Skylar without a second thought. "Look, see?" He turned the teen over and pointed to the back of his neck. "No gravity regulators." He turned Skylar over and pointed at his eyes. "No night vision."

Zalus rubbed the back of his neck and said, "Well, I GUESS...I was hoping I could see someone from my own planet again, you know?"

Markis smiled and patted the younger giant on the back. "I know, I was too. But I'm starting to think this is a one pair per planet kind of deal."

"Well, we should take them to Uther anyway." Zalus said, straightening back up.

Markis straightened up as well, still holding Skylar in his hand, his fingers (which were the size of tree trunks) wrapped securely around Skylar, holding him tight enough to show who was in charge here. Skylar was too dazed from his sudden capture to really do much except sit still. The two giants were about to start moving when Zalus felt something beat on his toes. He frowned and looked down, his expression softening when he saw Caleb using his fists to attack the giant's foot.

"Let my brother go you big jerk! He didn't do anything to you!"

Zalus gently picked Caleb up, the small boy trembling as he was suddenly grabbed, and said, "Don't worry, we're not going to hurt you OR your brother. We're just going to take you to a place where you'll be safe. You won't have to be alone either! Doesn't that sound great?"

"Stop babying the kid Zalus!" Markis said, already several feet away. "Come on, I want to get at least SOME sleep tonight!"

Zalus sighed and said, "Well, we'd better go. My name is Zalus by the way." He extended his finger to Caleb. "What's yours?"

"Caleb..." he said, grabbing the finger with his whole hand and shaking it.

"Nice to meet you!" Zalus said energetically, holding Caleb like you would a mouse. "I'm going to hold you like this in case I trip, okay? When I landed here with my brother one of my gravity regulators got damaged." He pressed lightly down on one of the ridges on the back of his neck, this one smaller and slightly misshapen when compared to the others. He winced and said, "It hasn't really healed yet and my e-equi..um...equilibum...equi...well I fall down a lot."

Caleb giggled and said, "Okay, just don't crush me or anything, okay?" He was adapting to this situation much quicker than Skylar was!

Zalus and Caleb chatted as they walked. Markis, on the other hand, was much quieter. Skylar wiggled around a bit, his heart pounding as he tried not to imagine what might become of him and his brother in the hands of these strange giants, and said, "Where are you taking us?"

"Hm? We're taking you to our city. Uther will fill you in on all the details and get you...situated." He grinned as he said this.

Skylar shuddered. Just what the heck did he mean by that? He put the question from his mind for now and said, "What is this place anyway? I thought we were the only ones here!"

Markis chuckled and said, "We all think that! That's what they want us to think for some reason. But there's quite a few of us. All of us in pairs, one older brother, one younger brother. Zalus and I are younger brothers."

"Your older brother must be..." Skylar said, gulping a bit, unable to finish that thought.

Markis laughed and said, "He's actually not much taller than you, though he's got WAY bigger muscles! Our planet has some ridiculous gravity! If we didn't have bulky bodies we'd be stuck in place, unable to move. I tell you, I feel as light as a feather on this planet!"

Skylar fell silent as he contemplated this information. He hadn't expected there to be such a severe height disparity between the brothers. Was Markis just a freak of nature, so to speak, on his planet? Or maybe it was some weird backwards biology where you were born a giant and slowly grew smaller as you got older? Or...maybe he was part of some experiment? It was impossible to say. This whole situation was beyond his comprehension.

The rest of the trip was passed in silence. Within an hour or so, they had arrived at their destination.
15533211.title: New Friends (?)

choices: It's Uther, who's so excited to see them that he can't wait, and has woken up.
It's a guard to take them to a holding cell, with another pair of new arrivals.
155332111.content:
As they finally reached the top of the last hill, Zalus and Markis stopped for a moment to catch their breath. Looking past the edge of the hand he was being carried in, Skylar saw that down in the valley below there looked to be a large village, almost the size of a city, with dozens if not hundreds of houses spread out along several streets. Each of these streets were dotted with perfectly-functioning street lamps, and they seemed to all diverge at the same point far in the distance, arranged in such a way that they formed the spokes of a wheel-like formation around a central hub.

"W-what is this place?" Skylar asked, his eyes fixated on the lights of the town below.

Zalus took a deep breath and smiled. "This is your new home. We simply call it 'The Hub,' since it's where everyone who lands here ends up, eventually. Well, almost everyone. Except--" He was cut off by Markis noticeably clearing his throat and shooting him a stern look. After a few awkward moments passed, he simply said, "Never mind."

A sense of worry gnawed at Skylar, but he didn't have time for any follow up questions, as they started moving down the hill into the village. Markis brought a finger to his lips, indicating that they should stay as quiet as possible, and so the other three boys complied.

As they passed through the village, Skylar noticed that the size of the houses seemed to vary wildly. They all seemed to be noticeably bigger than the houses back on their home planet, or even where they had stayed the night before, and they seemed to be getting bigger as they got closer to the center of the town. The first ones they came across seemed to be around thirty feet tall, looking like they might fit a boy around Markis' size, while the biggest stretched much taller overhead, at least a hundred feet tall, if not more. And it wasn't like they were multi-story houses; no, they all were single-level, they just had windows and doors that were noticeably bigger. "If there are boys here that are as big as those houses seem to indicate…" Skylar worried to himself.

So far, though, the streets were deserted. Being the middle of the night, Skylar assumed that most of the residents were sleeping, except for those out on patrol like Zalus and Markis (if there were any others like that). Of course, he had no idea how many people actually lived here, or if all or even any of these houses actually had people in them. Markis had mentioned that everyone here were pairs of brothers -- did that mean that there were no adults? An interesting idea, Skylar thought, but one that could mean trouble, and a lot of it, if things went out of hand.

Finally, they arrived at the center of the village, where a huge tower, almost like a fortress, loomed above them. "This is Uther's house," Zalus whispered. "You'll stay here tonight."

"Wow!" Caleb exclaimed, in awe at the imposing structure in front of them. "Is he your king?"

Zalus chuckled, and shook his head as Markis pushed open the huge wooden door part of the way and stepped through, Zalus following behind. "No, not quite. He's just the biggest among us, right now anyway, and so he gets the biggest house. It just so happens that house is also part of the central complex with all the laboratories and holding cells and all that stuff."

Labs? Holding cells? Skylar didn't like the sound of that one bit, and the fact that the entry hall they were in looked like a dimly lit dungeon didn't help. "Now just one minute," he said, his voice growing louder with excitement and a little bit of anger. "What are you doing with us? Are we your prisoners or something?"

"Please keep your voice, down!" Markis hissed at him, then continued in a hushed voice. "No, nothing like that. Once you've met Uther and the two of you are ready, you and Caleb will be given a house just like the rest of us and join our society. But we can't do that just yet."

"Why the hell not?" Skylar demanded, trying to sound forceful without being too loud.

"Because--" Markis shook his head, trying to suppress a smile that was forming. "Well, isn't it obvious?"

"Isn't what obvious?" Caleb asked, trying to match his brother's indignation but still sounding eager and excited, his eyes sparkling in the reflection of the light coming from the torch on the wall.

Markis rolled his eyes, while Zalus stifled a chuckle. "You're not big enough yet, tiny!" He gave Caleb a poke with a single finger, nearly knocking the small boy over in his palm. "Don't worry, though, that'll change soon enough!"

Before Skylar or Caleb could ask any more questions, the sound of footsteps approaching caused both Markis and Zalus to stand up straighter and face the archway at the opposite end of the entry hall. They both held out their hands in front of them, making sure that Skylar and Caleb were both clearly visible. As the footsteps got closer, they grew louder and louder; whoever was coming was much bigger than either Markis or Zalus. Skylar gulped, hoping that whoever it was would at least be as friendly as the two had been.
155332111.title: Home Sweet Home?

info.brief_description: Pick one of my guys and he'll grow into a giant.
info.description:
NEW RULES AS OF 11/25/11! Read them carefully BEFORE you add a new chapter:

1. Guys grow only! Keep female content to a minimum. No giantess, no muscle growth, nothing of that kind for the females! There's enough content out there for that if that's your thing. We're male oriented here.

2. No hard vore AND no toilet stuff of any kind!

3. Size is unlimited! They can grow as big as you want!

4. Multiple giants are allowed! Don't be afraid of having more than one guy grow!

5. Use proper grammar PLEASE and do not submit a chapter that is only one or two lines long! Each chapter should be of a decent length (at LEAST one or two paragraphs) and readable. There is a spell check for a reason!

6. With change of size comes with change of attitude. OoC is welcome.

7. Gay stuff is allowed! In case that's not been made obvious by now.

8. DO NOT add a choice chapter UNLESS you are also starting the story.

9. If you are going to start a new story, it must be at LEAST 2 paragraphs long, and comply with rule #5.

REPEAT OFFENDERS WILL BE BLOCKED! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Follow these rules and we'll get along just fine! Read, add, and enjoy!

Well, Giant Guys has finally reached 1000 chapters! It's been a crazy few years and I never thought this story would get so popular. I'd like to thank everyone who added over the years and special thanks to all those who made the effort to contact me through e-mail to set up more involved storylines. I couldn't have done it without all of you. Thank you!
